str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
This; he, she, it.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make blind, physically or mentally. From tuphlos; to make blind, i.e. to obscure.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From noieo; a perception, i.e. Purpose, or the intellect, disposition, itself.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(passively) untrustworthy (person), or incredible (thing).
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
To flash, gleam, shine forth, appear white, bright; but perhaps: I see, see clearly, discern. From auge; to beam forth.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Light, luster, illumination, enlightenment. From photizo; illumination.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
An image, likeness, bust. From eiko; a likeness, i.e. statue, profile, or representation, resemblance.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
